intro: Medicago polymorpha subsp. reticulata, commonly known as the reticulate medick, is a flowering plant in the legume family Fabaceae. It is characterized by its small, trifoliate leaves with a distinctive reticulate venation pattern. The plant produces yellow pea-like flowers that are typically clustered in racemes. It is a perennial herb that thrives in disturbed soils and is often found in grasslands and along roadsides. Its ability to fix nitrogen makes it an important pioneer species in ecological succession.
